On Thursday 15 July 2004 18:59, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> I am confused, t=
hough: why does "throws Exception" in a test lead to
> "throws Exception" i=
n production code? 

I did not mean to imply that.
Actually, I don't want "=
throws Exception" by default in production code.
My only point was hiding c=
umbersome exception specifications.

I'd as well prefer "throws MyColorExce=
ption" to "throws Exception", 
assuming I have MyColorException as base for=
 RedException, 
GreenException, and so on.

And my comment was on a situati=
on where I test my own code and not someone 
else's (which throws whatever =
checked exceptions).

Robert
